term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - integral capacitance of an electrode
term.title: integral capacitance

item.text: Integral capacitance (per unit area of electrode) is given by K = Q/(E - EQ=0) is the electric charge (per unit area of electrode), E is the potential of the electrode with respect to a reference electrode, and E Q = 0 is the potential at the point of zero charge.

item.title: potential at the point of zero charge
